source.8b278e27:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.gridspec as gridspec
import matplotlib.font_manager as fm

data = pd.read_csv("../input/kaggle-survey-2021/kaggle_survey_2021_responses.csv")[1:]
font = fm.FontProperties(fname='../input/acmeregular/Acme-Regular.ttf')

only_python = data[(data['Q7_Part_1']=='Python')& (data['Q7_Part_2']!='R')]
only_R = data[(data['Q7_Part_2']=='R')& (data['Q7_Part_1']!='Python')]
both = data[(data['Q7_Part_1']=='Python') & (data['Q7_Part_2']=='R')]

lan_data = {}
for column in data.columns[7:20]:
    if column == 'Q7_Part_1' or column == 'Q7_Part_2':
        lan_data[data[column].unique()[0]] = len(data[~data[column].isna()])
    else:
        lan_data[data[column].unique()[1]] = len(data[~data[column].isna()])
        
del(lan_data['None'])
del(lan_data['Other'])
source.da8f54a5:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(25,10),facecolor="white")
ax.patch.set_facecolor('white')
ax.axis("off")

spec = gridspec.GridSpec(ncols=10, nrows=1, figure=fig)
ax1 = fig.add_subplot(spec[0, :6],facecolor="white")
ax2 = fig.add_subplot(spec[0, 6:],facecolor="white")

ax1.bar(x=list(lan_data.keys()), height= list(lan_data.values()),width=0.6,color='#93BFFF')
ax1.spines['right'].set_visible(False)
ax1.spines['top'].set_visible(False)
ax1.spines['left'].set_visible(False)
ax1.axvspan(xmin = -0.5,xmax= 1.5, fc='#F4F4D6', alpha=0.3)

explode = [0.05, 0.05, 0.05]
ax2.pie([len(only_python),len(both),len(only_R)],explode=explode, shadow=True, startangle=90,colors=['#93BFFF','#F7FAC8','#F0B3AA'])
ax2.axis("off")
ax1.set_xticks("")

for i,name in enumerate(list(lan_data.keys())):
    ax1.text(s=name, x=i, y=-1000, ha='center', font =font, fontsize= 20)
    if i ==0 or i == 1:
        ax1.text(s=f"{round(list(lan_data.values())[i]/ sum(list(lan_data.values()))*100,2)}%", x=i, y=list(lan_data.values())[i]+500, ha='center', font =font, fontsize= 25)
ax1.text(s="<--- I want to focus this two language.",x=2, y=20000,font=font, fontsize=20)
ax1.text(s = "What programming languages do you use on a regular basis?",x=-0.5,y=25000, font=font, fontsize=30)
ax2.text(s="Only using Python",x=0.1,y=-0.2,font=font,color='#F5E9F5', va="center",ha="right",fontsize=30)
ax2.text(s=f"{round(len(only_python)/sum([len(only_python), len(both), len(only_R)])*100,1)}%",x=-0.5,y=-0.4,font=font,color='#F5E9F5', va="center",ha="center",fontsize=45)

ax2.text(s="Using both",x=0.8,y=0.6,font=font,color='#93BFFF', va="center",ha="right",fontsize=30)
ax2.text(s=f"{round(len(both)/sum([len(only_python), len(both), len(only_R)])*100,1)}%",x=0.55,y=0.4,font=font,color='#93BFFF', va="center",ha="center",fontsize=45)

ax2.text(s="Only using R",x=0.5,y=1.2,font=font,color='#5C2340', va="center",ha="right",fontsize=30)
ax2.text(s=f"{round(len(only_R)/sum([len(only_python), len(both), len(only_R)])*100,1)}%",x=0.8,y=1.2,font=font,color='#5C2340', va="center",ha="center",fontsize=45)
ax2.text(s = "Python, R user's rate",x=0,y=1.5, font=font, fontsize=30,va='center',ha='center')

plt.show()
source.9644586f:
a = only_python['Q1'].value_counts().sort_index()
a_value = a.values / sum(a.values)
b = only_R['Q1'].value_counts().sort_index()
b_value = b.values / sum(b.values)

fig = plt.figure(figsize=(20, 10))
plt.plot(a.keys(), a_value,alpha=0.3,color = '#93BFFF')
plt.bar(x = a.keys(), height = a_value,alpha=0.2,color = '#93BFFF')
plt.fill_between([*range(len(a.keys()))], 0, a_value, color='#93BFFF',alpha=0.3)

plt.plot(b.keys(), b_value,alpha=0.3, color = '#F0B3AA')
plt.bar(x = b.keys(), height = b_value,alpha=0.2,color = '#F0B3AA')
plt.fill_between([*range(len(b.keys()))], 0, b_value, color='#F0B3AA',alpha=0.3)

plt.gca().spines['right'].set_visible(False)
plt.gca().spines['top'].set_visible(False)
plt.xlim(0,)

plt.xticks(font=font,fontsize=25)
plt.yticks([0.05, 0.1, 0.15, 0.2],font=font,fontsize=25)

plt.text(s="Python", x = 2, y =0.2, font = font, fontsize=35,color = '#93BFFF')
plt.text(s="R", x = 6, y =0.1, font = font, fontsize=35,color = '#F0B3AA')

plt.title("What is your age?", font=font, fontsize=30)

plt.show()
source.8f34e708:
a = only_python['Q4'].value_counts().sort_index()
a_value = a.values / sum(a.values)
b = only_R['Q4'].value_counts().sort_index()
b_value = b.values / sum(b.values)

a_value = [a_value[2],a_value[6],a_value[4],a_value[0],a_value[3],a_value[5],a_value[1]]
b_value = [b_value[2],b_value[6],b_value[4],b_value[0],b_value[3],b_value[5],b_value[1]]

fig = plt.figure(figsize=(20, 10))

plt.bar(x = [*map(lambda x : x -0.15,[*range(len(a.keys()))])], height = a_value,alpha=0.6,color = '#93BFFF',width=0.28)
plt.bar(x = [*map(lambda x : x +0.15,[*range(len(a.keys()))])], height = b_value,alpha=0.6,color = '#F0B3AA',width=0.28)

plt.gca().spines['right'].set_visible(False)
plt.gca().spines['top'].set_visible(False)

plt.tick_params(axis='x',which='both',bottom=False,top=False,labelbottom=False) 
plt.yticks(font=font,fontsize=20)

plt.text(s="Python", x = -0.5, y =0.4, font = font, fontsize=30,color = '#93BFFF',ha='left')
plt.text(s="R", x = -0.5, y =0.36, font = font, fontsize=30,color = '#F0B3AA',ha='left')

for i,s in enumerate(['I prefer','Some college/university study','No formal education','Bachelor’s degree','Master’s degree','Professional doctorate','Doctoral degree']):
    if i >2:
        plt.text(s=s, x=i, y=-0.01, va='top',ha='center',font =font, fontsize=17)
    else:
        plt.text(s=s, x=i, y=-0.01, va='top',ha='center',font =font, fontsize=14)

for i,s in enumerate(['not to answer','without earning','past high school','','','','']):
    plt.text(s=s, x=i, y=-0.025, va='top',ha='center',font =font, fontsize=14)
for i,s in enumerate(['','a bachelor’s degree','','','','','']):
    plt.text(s=s, x=i, y=-0.04, va='top',ha='center',font =font, fontsize=14)

for i, pos in enumerate([*map(lambda x : x -0.15,[*range(len(a.keys()))])]):
    plt.text(s=f"{round(a_value[i]*100,1)}%", x=pos,y=a_value[i],font=font,fontsize=20,va='bottom',ha='center')
for i, pos in enumerate([*map(lambda x : x +0.15,[*range(len(a.keys()))])]):
    plt.text(s=f"{round(b_value[i]*100,1)}%", x=pos,y=b_value[i],font=font,fontsize=20,va='bottom',ha='center')

plt.title("What is the highest level of formal education that you have attained or plan to attain within the next 2 years?", font=font, fontsize=25)
plt.show()

source.b3200c20:
a = only_python['Q5'].value_counts().sort_index()
a = pd.DataFrame(a)
python_job = a.reset_index()
python_job['percentage'] = python_job['Q5']/sum(a.values)

b = only_R['Q5'].value_counts().sort_index()
b = pd.DataFrame(b)
R_job = b.reset_index()
R_job['percentage'] = R_job['Q5']/sum(b.values)

job_compare = pd.merge(left=R_job, right=python_job, on='index',how='outer')
job_compare = job_compare.fillna(0)
job_compare['percentage_y'] = job_compare['percentage_y']*-1

job_compare['percentage_x'] = job_compare['percentage_x']*100
job_compare['percentage_y'] = job_compare['percentage_y']*100
job_compare['percentage_x'] = job_compare['percentage_x']+8
job_compare['percentage_y'] = job_compare['percentage_y']-8

plt.figure(figsize=(20,20))
plt.barh(y=job_compare['index'], width=job_compare['percentage_x'],color='#F0B3AA')
plt.barh(y=job_compare['index'], width=job_compare['percentage_y'],color='#93BFFF')
plt.barh(y=job_compare['index'], width=[8]*len(job_compare),color = 'white')
plt.barh(y=job_compare['index'], width=[-8]*len(job_compare),color = 'white')
plt.axis('off')
for i,text in enumerate(list(job_compare['index'])):
    plt.text(s=text, x=0, y=i, font=font, fontsize=20,va='center',ha='center',alpha=0.8)
    
plt.text(s="Python", x = -15, y =15, font = font, fontsize=40,color = '#93BFFF',ha='center', va='center')
plt.text(s="R", x = 15, y =15, font = font, fontsize=40,color = '#F0B3AA',ha='center', va='center')

for i,value in enumerate(list(job_compare['percentage_x'])):
    plt.text(s=f"{round(value-8,1)}%", x=value+1, y=i, font=font, fontsize=20,va='center',ha='left')
    
for i,value in enumerate(list(job_compare['percentage_y'])):
    plt.text(s=f"{round(value+8,1)*-1}%", x=value-1, y=i, font=font, fontsize=20,va='center',ha='right')

plt.text(s="What is your job?",x=0, y=16, font=font, fontsize=35,va='center',ha='center')
plt.show()

source.3edaafe5:
a = only_python['Q8'].value_counts().sort_index()
a_value = a.values / sum(a.values)
b = only_R['Q8'].value_counts().sort_index()
b_value = b.values / sum(b.values)

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(25,10),facecolor="white")
ax.patch.set_facecolor('white')
ax.axis("off")

spec = gridspec.GridSpec(ncols=10, nrows=1, figure=fig)
ax1 = fig.add_subplot(spec[0, :5],facecolor="white")
ax2 = fig.add_subplot(spec[0, 5:],facecolor="white")


explode = [0.05, 0.05, 0.05]
ax1.pie([a['Python'], a['R'],sum(a) - a['Python'] - a['R']], shadow=True, startangle=90,colors=['#93BFFF','#F0B3AA','#F7FAC8'],wedgeprops=dict(width=0.3))
ax1.axis("off")

explode = [0.05, 0.05, 0.05]
ax2.pie([b['R'],b['Python'], sum(b) - b['R'] - b['Python']], shadow=True, startangle=90,colors=['#F0B3AA','#93BFFF','#F7FAC8'],wedgeprops=dict(width=0.3))
ax2.axis("off")

ax1.text(s="Python User's",x=0,y=0.1,font=font,color='#93BFFF', va="center",ha="center",fontsize=40)
ax1.text(s="Recommend",x=0,y=-0.1,font=font,color='#93BFFF', va="center",ha="center",fontsize=40)

ax1.text(s="Python",x=-1.2,y=-0.2,font=font,color='#93BFFF', va="center",ha="right",fontsize=25)
ax1.text(s=f"{round(a['Python']/sum([a['Python'], a['R'],sum(a) - a['Python'] - a['R']])*100,1)}%",x=-1.3,y=-0.4,font=font,color='#93BFFF', va="center",ha="center",fontsize=40)

ax1.text(s="R",x=1,y=0.9,font=font,color='#F0B3AA', va="center",ha="right",fontsize=25)
ax1.text(s=f"{round(a['R']/sum([a['Python'], a['R'],sum(a) - a['Python'] - a['R']])*100,1)}%",x=1,y=0.7,font=font,color='#F0B3AA', va="center",ha="center",fontsize=40)

ax1.text(s="Others",x=0.6,y=1.25,font=font,color='#FFF335', va="center",ha="right",fontsize=25)
ax1.text(s=f"{round((sum(a) - a['Python'] - a['R'])/sum([a['Python'], a['R'],sum(a) - a['Python'] - a['R']])*100,1)}%",x=0.5,y=1.05,font=font,color='#FFF335', va="center",ha="center",fontsize=40)



ax2.text(s="R User's",x=0,y=0.1,font=font,color='#F0B3AA', va="center",ha="center",fontsize=40)
ax2.text(s="Recommend",x=0,y=-0.1,font=font,color='#F0B3AA', va="center",ha="center",fontsize=40)

ax2.text(s="R",x=-1.3,y=-0.2,font=font,color='#F0B3AA', va="center",ha="right",fontsize=25)
ax2.text(s=f"{round(b['R']/sum([b['R'],b['Python'], sum(b) - b['R'] - b['Python']])*100,1)}%",x=-1.3,y=-0.4,font=font,color='#F0B3AA', va="center",ha="center",fontsize=40)

ax2.text(s="Python",x=1.3,y=-0.5,font=font,color='#93BFFF', va="center",ha="right",fontsize=25)
ax2.text(s=f"{round(b['Python']/sum([b['R'],b['Python'], sum(b) - b['R'] - b['Python']])*100,1)}%",x=1.2,y=-0.7,font=font,color='#93BFFF', va="center",ha="center",fontsize=40)

ax2.text(s="Others",x=0.8,y=1.2,font=font,color='#FFF335', va="center",ha="right",fontsize=25)
ax2.text(s=f"{round((sum(b) - b['R'] - b['Python'])/sum([b['R'],b['Python'], sum(b) - b['R'] - b['Python']])*100,1)}%",x=0.7,y=1,font=font,color='#FFF335', va="center",ha="center",fontsize=40)

plt.text(s="What programming language would you recommend an aspiring data scientist to learn first?", x= -1.5, y=1.55, font=font, fontsize=35, va='center', ha='center')

plt.show()
source.6c4a2cb5:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(25,10),facecolor="white")
ax.patch.set_facecolor('white')
ax.axis("off")

spec = gridspec.GridSpec(ncols=13, nrows=1, figure=fig)
ax1 = fig.add_subplot(spec[0, :6],facecolor="white")
ax2 = fig.add_subplot(spec[0, 7:],facecolor="white")

a = only_python['Q21'].value_counts().sort_index()
a_value = a.values / sum(a.values)
b = only_R['Q21'].value_counts().sort_index()
b_value = b.values / sum(b.values)
a_value = [a_value[0],a_value[4],a_value[3],a_value[2],a_value[1]]
b_value = [b_value[0],b_value[4],b_value[3],b_value[2],b_value[1]]

ax1.bar(x = [*map(lambda x : x -0.15,[*range(len(a.keys()))])], height = a_value,alpha=0.6,color = '#93BFFF',width=0.28)
ax1.bar(x = [*map(lambda x : x +0.15,[*range(len(a.keys()))])], height = b_value,alpha=0.6,color = '#F0B3AA',width=0.28)

ax1.spines['right'].set_visible(False)
ax1.spines['top'].set_visible(False)
ax1.spines['left'].set_visible(False)
ax1.set_xticks([])
ax1.set_yticks([])

ax1.text(s="Python", x = 4.3, y =0.30, font = font, fontsize=30,color = '#93BFFF',ha='right')
ax1.text(s="R", x = 4.3, y =0.26, font = font, fontsize=30,color = '#F0B3AA',ha='right')
for i,s in enumerate(['0-49 employees',
                        '50-249',
                        '250-999',
                        '1000-9,999',
                        '10,000 or more',]):
    ax1.text(s=s, x=i, y=-0.01, va='top',ha='center',font =font, fontsize=20)
    
for i, pos in enumerate([*map(lambda x : x -0.15,[*range(len(a.keys()))])]):
    ax1.text(s=f"{round(a_value[i]*100,1)}%", x=pos,y=a_value[i],font=font,fontsize=14,va='bottom',ha='center')
for i, pos in enumerate([*map(lambda x : x +0.15,[*range(len(a.keys()))])]):
    ax1.text(s=f"{round(b_value[i]*100,1)}%", x=pos,y=b_value[i],font=font,fontsize=14,va='bottom',ha='center')
ax1.set_title("What is the size of the company where you are employed?", font=font, fontsize=25)
#--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
a = only_python['Q22'].value_counts().sort_index()
a_value = a.values / sum(a.values)
b = only_R['Q22'].value_counts().sort_index()
b_value = b.values / sum(b.values)
a_value = [a_value[0],a_value[1],a_value[5],a_value[6],a_value[2],a_value[3],a_value[4]]
b_value = [b_value[0],b_value[1],b_value[5],b_value[6],b_value[2],b_value[3],b_value[4]]

ax2.bar(x = [*map(lambda x : x -0.15,[*range(len(a.keys()))])], height = a_value,alpha=0.6,color = '#93BFFF',width=0.28)
ax2.bar(x = [*map(lambda x : x +0.15,[*range(len(a.keys()))])], height = b_value,alpha=0.6,color = '#F0B3AA',width=0.28)

ax2.spines['right'].set_visible(False)
ax2.spines['top'].set_visible(False)
ax2.spines['left'].set_visible(False)
ax2.set_xticks([])
ax2.set_yticks([])

for i,s in enumerate(['0',
                    '1-2',
                    '3-4',
                    '5-9',
                    '10-14',
                    '15-19',
                    '20+']):
    ax2.text(s=s, x=i, y=-0.01, va='top',ha='center',font =font, fontsize=20)
    
for i, pos in enumerate([*map(lambda x : x -0.15,[*range(len(a.keys()))])]):
    ax2.text(s=f"{round(a_value[i]*100,1)}%", x=pos,y=a_value[i],font=font,fontsize=11,va='bottom',ha='center')
for i, pos in enumerate([*map(lambda x : x +0.15,[*range(len(a.keys()))])]):
    ax2.text(s=f"{round(b_value[i]*100,1)}%", x=pos,y=b_value[i],font=font,fontsize=11,va='bottom',ha='center')
ax2.set_title("How many individuals are responsible for data science workloads at your place of business?", font=font, fontsize=20)

plt.show()
source.cd653c37:
def split_data1(st):
    tmp = str(st).split(", ")[0]
    return tmp[3:-2]
def split_data2(st):
    tmp = str(st).split(", ")[1]
    if tmp[1:-1] =='':
        return 0
    else:
        return tmp[1:-1]
a = []
for i in ['Q14_Part_1','Q14_Part_2','Q14_Part_3','Q14_Part_4','Q14_Part_5','Q14_Part_6','Q14_Part_7','Q14_Part_8','Q14_Part_9','Q14_Part_10','Q14_Part_11','Q14_OTHER']:
    a.append([*only_python[i].value_counts().items()])
    
a = pd.DataFrame(a)
a.columns = ['s']
a['lib'] = a['s'].apply(split_data1)
a['count'] = a['s'].apply(split_data2)
a = a.drop(['s'],axis=1)

b = []
for i in ['Q14_Part_1','Q14_Part_2','Q14_Part_3','Q14_Part_4','Q14_Part_5','Q14_Part_6','Q14_Part_7','Q14_Part_8','Q14_Part_9','Q14_Part_10','Q14_Part_11','Q14_OTHER']:
    b.append([*only_R[i].value_counts().items()])
    
b = pd.DataFrame(b)
b.columns = ['s']
b['lib'] = b['s'].apply(split_data1)
b['count'] = b['s'].apply(split_data2)
b = b.drop(['s'],axis=1)

vis = pd.merge(right=a, left=b,on='lib', how='outer')
vis['count_x'] = pd.to_numeric(vis['count_x'])
vis['count_y'] = pd.to_numeric(vis['count_y'])

vis['count_x'] = vis['count_x']/sum(vis['count_x'])* 100
vis['count_y'] = vis['count_y']/sum(vis['count_y'])* 100

R_others = vis[(vis['lib']=='D3 js')|(vis['lib']=='Altair')|(vis['lib']=='Bokeh')|(vis['lib']=='Geoplotlib')|(vis['lib']=='Leaflet / Folium')].sum()['count_x'] + vis.loc[11,'count_x']
R_none = vis.loc[10,'count_x']
Python_others = vis[(vis['lib']=='D3 js')|(vis['lib']=='Altair')|(vis['lib']=='Bokeh')|(vis['lib']=='Geoplotlib')|(vis['lib']=='Leaflet / Folium')].sum()['count_y'] + vis.loc[11,'count_y']
Python_none = vis.loc[10,'count_y']

others = pd.DataFrame(['Others', R_others, Python_others]).T
others.columns = vis.columns
none = pd.DataFrame(['None', R_none, Python_none]).T
none.columns = vis.columns

vis = pd.concat([vis.iloc[:5],others,none])
vis = vis.reset_index(drop=True)

vis['count_x'] = vis['count_x'] +10
vis['count_y'] = vis['count_y']*-1 -10

plt.figure(figsize=(20,13))
plt.barh(y=vis['lib'], width=vis['count_x'],color='#F0B3AA')
plt.barh(y=vis['lib'], width=vis['count_y'],color='#93BFFF')
plt.barh(y=vis['lib'], width=[10]*len(vis),color = 'white')
plt.barh(y=vis['lib'], width=[-10]*len(vis),color = 'white')
plt.axis('off')
for i,text in enumerate(list(vis['lib'])):
    plt.text(s=text, x=0, y=i, font=font, fontsize=20,va='center',ha='center',alpha=0.8)
    
plt.text(s="Python", x = -12, y =7, font = font, fontsize=40,color = '#93BFFF',ha='right', va='center')
plt.text(s="R", x = 12, y =7, font = font, fontsize=40,color = '#F0B3AA',ha='left', va='center')

for i,value in enumerate(list(vis['count_x'])):
    plt.text(s=f"{round(value-10,1)}%", x=value+1, y=i, font=font, fontsize=20,va='center',ha='left')
    
for i,value in enumerate(list(vis['count_y'])):
    plt.text(s=f"{round(value+10,1)*-1}%", x=value-1, y=i, font=font, fontsize=20,va='center',ha='right')

plt.text(s="What data visualization libraries or tools do you use on a regular basis?",x=0, y=8, font=font, fontsize=35,va='center',ha='center')
plt.show()

#### In fact, I think this is the most interesting part. (Money is best...)
#### Among Python users, it was expected that the annual salary could be higher because of ML/AI-related jobs, but the annual salary of R users was higher due to the high educational background and experience of R users.
#### And since Python is used for introductory purposes, it is presumed that low salaries are high.

#### And Using Python and R user's rate are more than 20%, R user's rate is only 3.3%
#### In this work. I compared Only using Python user and Only using R user.

source.e947587a:
#### I'm one of the Python users. I'm satisfied with Python in almost every part, but I'm very envious of the visualization of R.
#### The visualization of R is so neat and beautiful.
#### Look this chart's None, The Python's None rate is 13.5%. It mean that, 13.5% not using visualization. But R is only 1.9%. 
#### It seems to mean that R users are more interested in visualization than Python users. Of course, one of the reasons seems to be that R user has a lot of experience.
#### And, Python user's best pick is Matplotlib. It's Half.
#### R user's best pick is Shiny and then ggplot.
source.583560cf:

#### And, In R, It shown statistician, Data Analyst.
#### I thought most of the researchers and data scientists would use python, but I was surprised to see that they also accounted for a large percentage of R.
